Most experienced players agree that there is not enough to distinguish between different [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") in the game. A few are very useful, the others are rarely worth bothering to lug around. Many people have discussed how to improve them in [RGRN](/wiki/RGRN "RGRN") and [IRC](/wiki/IRC "IRC"). Here is a summary of some of the ideas posted.

Some past threads in [RGRN](/wiki/RGRN "RGRN") (via Google Groups):

- [\[1\]](http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/0dfac8a8086791c8/4040608cd3878979?hl=en#4040608cd3878979)
- [\[2\]](http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/8b397ef6ef264c0b/ce9e03a986e7784d?lnk=gst\&q=artifact+balance\&rnum=1\&hl=en#ce9e03a986e7784d)
- [\[3\]](http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/169d0e7ec3d5c642/4af21b274df6ae1a?lnk=gst\&q=dragonbane+silver+lance\&rnum=2\&hl=en#4af21b274df6ae1a)

## Existing patches

Some of these ideas have already been implemented in Nephi's enhanced artifacts patch.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1) They are marked below.

[L](/wiki/L_\(person\) "L (person)") has also produced a few [artifact patches](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/) for:

- [The Heart of Ahriman](https://web.archive.org/web/20180902003154/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-heart_of_ahriman.diff)
- [The Sceptre of Might](https://web.archive.org/web/20180902002754/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sceptre_of_might.diff)
- [Sunsword](https://web.archive.org/web/20180902002859/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sunsword.diff)
- [Tsurugi of Muramasa](https://web.archive.org/web/20180902003219/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/invoke_muramasa.diff)
- [Itlachiayaque](https://web.archive.org/web/20190103071629/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/itlachiayaque.diff) (new artifact)

There is also the [owned artifacts patch](https://web.archive.org/web/20111122030050/http://www.netsonic.fi:80/~walker/nethack.html) by Topi Linkala. If you wish for an artifact there is a chance that the owner of that artifact arrives with the artifact and starts to fight with you.

Derek Ray's [Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack") contains various artifact fixes, indicated below.

## General ideas

- Too many of the artifacts are longswords. More diversity would be good.
- Too many of the artifacts are weapons. More diversity would be good. For example, [items, tools, armor](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/d12758a474ad036a/df79ab32d9a04379), or even [food](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/8af1716dff6cd8e/86730cfc51f7f942).
- We need an artifact spear—spears are cool!

## Vanilla implementations

Beginning with [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"), several of these ideas have been implemented:

- Demonbane blocks [demon gating](/wiki/Demon_gating "Demon gating") while wielded.
- Dragonbane confers [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") while wielded.
- Trollsbane prevents [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") from reviving while wielded.
- Ogresmasher grants 25 constitution while wielded.
- Cleaver hits up to three adjacent enemies in an arc.

## Bane weapons

- All banes warn you of targeted monsters, like Sting does for orcs.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- All banes give you +d8 to hit and +d20 to damage, rather than +d5 to hit and double damage. This makes them more useful without having to spend skill slots and enchant weapon scrolls.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Foo-banes have a 1⁄6 chance of cancelling foo monsters ([SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), copied to [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"))

### [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane")

- Demonbane prevents demons' gating ability, but not the magical power of [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties").[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1) Implemented in 3.6.1.
- Demonbane is a silver mace which does double damage against demons, provides warning against demons, and, when wielded, prevents demons from summoning in your presence. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))
- Wielding Demonbane prevents summoning of demons for monsters and player. ([UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"))

### [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane")

- Dragonbane grants reflection.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1) Implemented in 3.6.1.
- Dragonbane is an unbreakable silver lance (better for Knights).
- Dragonbane is now a normal spear that provides fire, cold, poison, shock, sleep, acid, and disintegration resistance when wielded. It does double damage against dragons, kills dragons instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and provides warning against dragons. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

### [Giantslayer](/wiki/Giantslayer "Giantslayer")

- On a critical hit (a "natural 20"), Giantslayer will kill up to seven giants adjacent to you ("Seven at one blow!").[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Giantslayer as a dwarvish mattock, able to destroy boulders thrown at you.
- Giantslayer is now a sling which provides warning against giants. Giantslayer kills giants on *any* successful hit with a rock fired from this sling. Rocks fired from Giantslayer do +d8 damage. Giantslayer provides strength 18/\*\* when wielded OR in your alternate weapon slot. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))
- Wielding Giantslayer grants strength 18/\*\*. ([UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"))

### [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher")

- Ogresmasher gives ogre strength (18/\*\*)—great for elven Priests!
- Ogresmasher provides constitution 25 when wielded, does double damage against all ogres, kills ogres instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and provides warning against ogres. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"); the CON 25 has been implemented in 3.6.1.)

### [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist")

- Orcrist does +d4 damage against everything, double damage against orcs, and warns of orcs. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

### [Trollsbane](/wiki/Trollsbane "Trollsbane")

- Trollsbane gives hungerless regeneration.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Trolls killed by Trollsbane will not revive.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1) Especially useful for Barbarian quest.
- Trollsbane does double damage against trolls, kills trolls instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and dying trolls do not leave a corpse when Trollsbane is wielded. Trollsbane provides hungerless regeneration when wielded. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

### [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane")

- Werebane could grant unchanging and protection from shape changers.
- Werebane provides polymorph control when wielded. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

## Brand weapons

### [Fire and Frost Brand](/wiki/Fire_and_Frost_Brand "Fire and Frost Brand")

- [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") are short swords that can be [twoweaponed](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") with each other. ([NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"))

## Early-game weapons

### [Grimtooth](/wiki/Grimtooth "Grimtooth")

- Grimtooth is now a (permanantly) poisoned weapon. This makes it somewhat useful in the early game (instead of worthless like it is now), but not so much in the late game, where most of the tougher monsters are poison resistant.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Grimtooth has +d5 to hit. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

### [Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting")

It is generally agreed that Sting should remain as-is.

- Sting does +d3 damage against everything, double damage against spiders, and warns of spiders. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

## Other weapons

### [Cleaver](/wiki/Cleaver "Cleaver")

### [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur")

- [GreyKnight's patch](http://bilious.alt.org/?278) transfers some of Excalibur's powers to a new artifact Clarent (see below)

### [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir")

- Double damage only against undead, demons, and chaotics—it's overpowered as it is!

### [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana")

- Make the arrows never stop flying until they hit a target or an obstacle, regardless of your strength.
- Would be nice to have a 5%+ chance of instakilling enemies (arrows piercing the heart of \<monster>).

### [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane")

### [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir")

### [The Sceptre of Might](/wiki/The_Sceptre_of_Might "The Sceptre of Might")

- The Sceptre sets strength to 25 ([L's Patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sceptre_of_might.diff))

### [Snickersnee](/wiki/Snickersnee "Snickersnee")

- Snickersnee should do 1d12 extra damage, not 1d8, and get +1d5 to hit. This is because it's harder to get than Excalibur, yet generally less powerful. Since it has none of Excalibur's beneficial side effects (nor any of its drawbacks, granted), it should be a more effective weapon.

### [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius")

### [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer")

### [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword")

- Sunsword has a 1 in 3 chance of blinding opponents.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Sunsword has a light radius of 3 instead of 2. This gives players more of an incentive to wield it when they don't have a lamp.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Sunsword insta-kills gremlins. ([L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sunsword.diff))
- Sunsword turns trolls to stone. ([L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sunsword.diff))
- Sunsword is now a silver long sword. ([Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"))

### [The Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/The_Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "The Tsurugi of Muramasa")

- The Tsurugi of Muramasa now does double damage instead of +d8. This puts it in the running for the most powerful weapon in the game, which is where it should be. That it is a two-handed weapon balances it somewhat.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)
- Invoking the Tsurugi raises its enchantment to +1/0/\&minus1 if blessed/uncursed/cursed ([L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/invoke_muramasa.diff))

### [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade")

- Vorpal Blade now does +d8 to damage, instead of the ridiculously low +1.[\[1\]](#cite_note-Nephi-1)

## Non-weapon artifacts

### [The Orb of Detection](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Detection "The Orb of Detection")

- Replaced by Itlachiayaque (below) in [L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/itlachiayaque.diff)
- Replaced by Stonecutter (below).

### [The Heart of Ahriman](/wiki/The_Heart_of_Ahriman "The Heart of Ahriman")

- The Heart of Ahriman confers displacement instead of stealth. ([L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-heart_of_ahriman.diff), included in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"))
- The Heart of Ahriman gives energy regeneration ([L's patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-heart_of_ahriman.diff))
- The Heart of Ahriman grants magic resistance when carried. (implemented in dNethack)

### [The Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin")

### [The Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/The_Eyes_of_the_Overworld "The Eyes of the Overworld")

### [The Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness")

### [The Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery")

### [The Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card")

### [The Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate")

### [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")

## New artifact ideas

### Philosopher's Stone

Part of Malcolm Ryan's planned [Alchemist patch](http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/4cfc4446a24002f/eca165870234272d?). The philosopher's stone is a [gray stone](/wiki/Gray_stone "Gray stone") which can absorb the essence of a potion and then be used to make other potions.

### Itlachiayaque

L's [Itlachiayaque patch](http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/itlachiayaque.diff) replaces the Archeologist's quest artifact, the Orb of Detection, with Itlachiayaque, a shield of reflection that in legend was wielded by the Mesoamerican deity Tezcatlipoca.

- Is a shield of reflection (thus, automatically confers 2 AC and reflection).
- Confers ESP, half spell damage and fire resistance when carried.
- When invoked, it creates a stinking cloud that the player can place unless Itlachiayaque is cursed or the player is not an Archeologist.

### Clarent

GreyKnight's [Clarent patch](http://bilious.alt.org/?278) complements [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") with Clarent, the *other* sword from Arthurian legend (the sword in the stone). Clarent is an intelligent lawful short sword which can be dual-wielded with Excalibur. See the link above for a list of other powers.

### Stonecutter

Proposed by [Raisse](/wiki/User:Raisse "User:Raisse") as a replacement for the [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") quest artifact [here](http://valdyas.org/~irina/stonecutter). It is a [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock").

- +d3 to-hit, +d6 damage.
- Double damage against "earth" and "stone" monsters, including earth elementals, xorns, clay and stone golems, gargoyles, and potentially piercers and rock moles.
- Fast digging: digs through rock at the speed of non-hasted walking, and digs through the floor in one turn.
- Blocks stoning by the hissing attack of cockatrices and chickatrices, though not by any other means.
- When invoked, gives the same effect as a blessed [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection").

The Staff of Aesculapius

Stormbringer

Sunsword

  • Sunsword has a 1 in 3 chance of blinding opponents.[1]
  • Sunsword has a light radius of 3 instead of 2. This gives players more of an incentive to wield it when they don't have a lamp.[1]
  • Sunsword insta-kills gremlins. (L's patch)
  • Sunsword turns trolls to stone. (L's patch)
  • Sunsword is now a silver long sword. (Sporkhack)

The Tsurugi of Muramasa

  • The Tsurugi of Muramasa now does double damage instead of +d8. This puts it in the running for the most powerful weapon in the game, which is where it should be. That it is a two-handed weapon balances it somewhat.[1]
  • Invoking the Tsurugi raises its enchantment to +1/0/&minus1 if blessed/uncursed/cursed (L's patch)

Vorpal Blade

  • Vorpal Blade now does +d8 to damage, instead of the ridiculously low +1.[1]

Non-weapon artifacts

The Orb of Detection

  • Replaced by Itlachiayaque (below) in L's patch
  • Replaced by Stonecutter (below).

The Heart of Ahriman

  • The Heart of Ahriman confers displacement instead of stealth. (L's patch, included in UnNetHack)
  • The Heart of Ahriman gives energy regeneration (L's patch)
  • The Heart of Ahriman grants magic resistance when carried. (implemented in dNethack)

New artifact ideas

Philosopher's Stone

Part of Malcolm Ryan's planned Alchemist patch. The philosopher's stone is a gray stone which can absorb the essence of a potion and then be used to make other potions.

Itlachiayaque

L's Itlachiayaque patch replaces the Archeologist's quest artifact, the Orb of Detection, with Itlachiayaque, a shield of reflection that in legend was wielded by the Mesoamerican deity Tezcatlipoca.

  • Is a shield of reflection (thus, automatically confers 2 AC and reflection).
  • Confers ESP, half spell damage and fire resistance when carried.
  • When invoked, it creates a stinking cloud that the player can place unless Itlachiayaque is cursed or the player is not an Archeologist.

Clarent

GreyKnight's Clarent patch complements Excalibur with Clarent, the other sword from Arthurian legend (the sword in the stone). Clarent is an intelligent lawful short sword which can be dual-wielded with Excalibur. See the link above for a list of other powers.

Stonecutter

Proposed by Raisse as a replacement for the Archeologist quest artifact here. It is a dwarvish mattock.

  • +d3 to-hit, +d6 damage.
  • Double damage against "earth" and "stone" monsters, including earth elementals, xorns, clay and stone golems, gargoyles, and potentially piercers and rock moles.
  • Fast digging: digs through rock at the speed of non-hasted walking, and digs through the floor in one turn.
  • Blocks stoning by the hissing attack of cockatrices and chickatrices, though not by any other means.
  • When invoked, gives the same effect as a blessed potion of object detection.

Most experienced players agree that there is not enough to distinguish between different [[artifact]]s in the game. A few are very useful, the others are rarely worth bothering to lug around. Many people have discussed how to improve them in [[RGRN]] and [[IRC]]. Here is a summary of some of the ideas posted.

Some past threads in [[RGRN]] (via Google Groups):
* [http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/0dfac8a8086791c8/4040608cd3878979?hl=en#4040608cd3878979]
* [http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/8b397ef6ef264c0b/ce9e03a986e7784d?lnk=gst&q=artifact+balance&rnum=1&hl=en#ce9e03a986e7784d]
* [http://groups.google.com.au/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/169d0e7ec3d5c642/4af21b274df6ae1a?lnk=gst&q=dragonbane+silver+lance&rnum=2&hl=en#4af21b274df6ae1a]

==Existing patches==
Some of these ideas have already been implemented in Nephi's enhanced artifacts patch.<ref name="Nephi">[[http://bilious.alt.org/?208 Nephi's artifact patch], which has been included in [[UnNetHack]].</ref> They are marked below.

[[L (person)|L]] has also produced a few [http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/ artifact patches] for:
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20180902003154/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-heart_of_ahriman.diff The Heart of Ahriman]
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20180902002754/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sceptre_of_might.diff The Sceptre of Might]
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20180902002859/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/banes-sunsword.diff Sunsword]
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20180902003219/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/invoke_muramasa.diff Tsurugi of Muramasa]
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20190103071629/http://l.j-factor.com/nethack/itlachiayaque.diff Itlachiayaque] (new artifact)

There is also the [https://web.archive.org/web/20111122030050/http://www.netsonic.fi:80/~walker/nethack.html owned artifacts patch] by Topi Linkala. If you wish for an artifact there is a chance that the owner of that artifact arrives with the artifact and starts to fight with you.

Derek Ray's [[Sporkhack]] contains various artifact fixes, indicated below.

==General ideas==

* Too many of the artifacts are longswords. More diversity would be good.
* Too many of the artifacts are weapons. More diversity would be good. For example, [http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/d12758a474ad036a/df79ab32d9a04379 items, tools, armor], or even [http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_thread/thread/8af1716dff6cd8e/86730cfc51f7f942 food].
* We need an artifact spear—spears are cool!

==Vanilla implementations==
Beginning with [[NetHack 3.6.1]], several of these ideas have been implemented:
* Demonbane blocks [[demon gating]] while wielded.
* Dragonbane confers [[reflection]] while wielded.
* Trollsbane prevents [[Troll (monster class)|trolls]] from reviving while wielded.
* Ogresmasher grants 25 constitution while wielded.
* Cleaver hits up to three adjacent enemies in an arc.

==Bane weapons==

* All banes warn you of targeted monsters, like Sting does for orcs.<ref name="Nephi" />
* All banes give you +d8 to hit and +d20 to damage, rather than +d5 to hit and double damage. This makes them more useful without having to spend skill slots and enchant weapon scrolls.<ref name="Nephi" />
* Foo-banes have a {{frac|6}} chance of cancelling foo monsters ([[SLASH'EM]], copied to [[UnNetHack]]) 

===[[Demonbane]]===
* Demonbane prevents demons' gating ability, but not the magical power of [[summon nasties]].<ref name="Nephi" /> Implemented in 3.6.1.
* Demonbane is a silver mace which does double damage against demons, provides warning against demons, and, when wielded, prevents demons from summoning in your presence. ([[Sporkhack]])
* Wielding Demonbane prevents summoning of demons for monsters and player. ([[UnNetHack]])

===[[Dragonbane]]===
* Dragonbane grants reflection.<ref name="Nephi" /> Implemented in 3.6.1.
* Dragonbane is an unbreakable silver lance (better for Knights).
* Dragonbane is now a normal spear that provides fire, cold, poison, shock, sleep, acid, and disintegration resistance when wielded. It does double damage against dragons, kills dragons instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and provides warning against dragons. ([[Sporkhack]])

===[[Giantslayer]]===
* On a critical hit (a "natural 20"), Giantslayer will kill up to seven giants adjacent to you ("Seven at one blow!").<ref name="Nephi" />
* Giantslayer as a dwarvish mattock, able to destroy boulders thrown at you.
* Giantslayer is now a sling which provides warning against giants. Giantslayer kills giants on ''any'' successful hit with a rock fired from this sling. Rocks fired from Giantslayer do +d8 damage. Giantslayer provides strength 18/** when wielded OR in your alternate weapon slot. ([[Sporkhack]])
* Wielding Giantslayer grants strength 18/**. ([[UnNetHack]])

===[[Ogresmasher]]===
* Ogresmasher gives ogre strength (18/**)—great for elven Priests!
* Ogresmasher provides constitution 25 when wielded, does double damage against all ogres, kills ogres instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and provides warning against ogres. ([[Sporkhack]]; the CON 25 has been implemented in 3.6.1.)

===[[Orcrist]]===
* Orcrist does +d4 damage against everything, double damage against orcs, and warns of orcs. ([[Sporkhack]])

===[[Trollsbane]]===
* Trollsbane gives hungerless regeneration.<ref name="Nephi" />
* Trolls killed by Trollsbane will not revive.<ref name="Nephi" /> Especially useful for Barbarian quest.
* Trollsbane does double damage against trolls, kills trolls instantly 50% of the time on a successful hit, and dying trolls do not leave a corpse when Trollsbane is wielded. Trollsbane provides hungerless regeneration when wielded. ([[Sporkhack]])

===[[Werebane]]===
* Werebane could grant unchanging and protection from shape changers.
* Werebane provides polymorph control when wielded. ([[Sporkhack]])

==Brand weapons==
===[[Fire and Frost Brand]]===
* [[Fire Brand]] and [[Frost Brand]] are short swords that can be [[twoweapon]]ed with each other. ([[NetHack Fourk]], [[dNetHack]],  [[xNetHack]])

==Early-game weapons==
===[[Grimtooth]]===
* Grimtooth is now a (permanantly) poisoned weapon. This makes it somewhat useful in the early game (instead of worthless like it is now), but not so much in the late game, where most of the tougher monsters are poison resistant.<ref name="Nephi" />
* Grimtooth has +d5 to hit. ([[Sporkhack]])

===[[Sting]]===
It is generally agreed that Sting should remain as-is.
* Sting does +d3 damage against everything, double damage against spiders, and warns of spiders. ([[Sporkhack]])
